content.title: Credit Linked Subsidy Scheme for Rural Entrepreneurs to set up Custom Hiring Centres (CHC) of Farm Machinery
content.details: Credit Linked Subsidy Scheme for Rural Entrepreneurs to set up Custom Hiring Centres (CHC) of Farm Machinery under the Farm Mechanization Umbrella Scheme, was launched on 22nd October 2014, by the Agriculture Department, Government of West Bengal with the purpose to provide opportunity to rural entrepreneurs for setting up of Custom Hiring Centres to enable the farmers to hire different high end farm machinery from them at a reasonable rate with the objective of rural employment, enhanced productivity and risk mitigation during calamities. The scheme is applicable uniformly throughout the State, except Kolkata district.
benefits: Maximum subsidy limited to 40% of the Total Financial Outlay (TFO)
Maximum subsidy amounting ₹16,00,000/- or 40% of the TFO, whichever is less
Subsidy applicable for purchase of farm machinery/equipment from approved manufacturers and dealers
eligibility: Individual farmers registered under Krishak Bandhu (New) Scheme
Groups like SKUS/PACS/FPO/FPC/FIG/SHG duly graded/recognized by any Govt. Institutions/Departments
Project cost/TFO should be between minimum ₹20,00,000/- to maximum as per SMAM Guideline
Sufficient land under possession for setting up the CHC
Beneficiary age should be minimum 18 years at the time of application
exclusions: Beneficiary or spouse not eligible to apply afresh before completion of 4 years from last subsidy release
Employees/retired employees of State Government, Statutory Bodies, Government Undertakings, etc. are not eligible
content.application_process: Online registration through the official FMS portal. After successful submission of online application, hard copies of the application with required documents must be submitted to the office of the Deputy Director of Agriculture of the concerned District.
documents_required: Self-authenticated photocopy of updated bank pass-book
Title Deed/ROR/Lease Certificate/Rent Receipt of land
Vetted plan & estimate for shade of CHC
Resolution of the organization regarding authorization of signatory in the application

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To provide assistance to rural entrepreneurs for setting up Custom Hiring Centres to enable farmers to hire farm machinery.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department Of Agriculture, Government of West Bengal.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Individual farmers registered under Krishak Bandhu (New) Scheme or recognized groups.

faqs.question: How to avail the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Apply online in Matirkatha/FMS portal and submit hard copies of the application with required documents.

faqs.question: Is there any fee or charges to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there are no charges to apply for this scheme.
